body.name: SHAN ZU Chef Knife 8 Inch Japanese Steel Damascus Kitchen Knife, Professional Kitchen Knives Sharp High Carbon Super Steel Kitchen Utility Knife
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Friday, February 16. Order within 4 hrs 36 mins
features: 【Japanese Steel Knife Core, Super Sharp】SHAN ZU chef's knife core is made of Damascus Japanese steel AUS-10 that has high hardness(62HRC), anti-corrosion, and wear-resistant features; combined with advanced modern forging technique, you will get a super sharp kitchen knife.

【REAL Damascus Knife, not Lazer Etched】Damascus knife is famous for its beautiful pattern, SHAN ZU Damascus pattern technique involves layering sheets of carbon steel, and applying excessive heat treatments with repeated folding and forging until the blade pattern is formed. The pattern gets more visible after polishing. In modern-day, there is a fake Damascus knife that has merely been laser-etched (surface treated) to produce a pattern, it is fake Damascus since the pattern can be worn away.

【Forged by 67-Layer sheets of steel, Long-Lasting Use】Besides on the knife core, there are still 66 layers of carbon steel that are forged on the blade. A total of 67 layers of steel structure greatly enhances the characteristics of corrosion resistance, rust prevention, and toughness, it would be a long-lasting use utility knife.

【Glass Fiber G10 Handle, Comfortable Grip & Solid】 Adopts frosted glass fiber G10 handle which is much more comfortable and solider than the wood handle, it becomes an ergonomically designed top-balanced professional knife to provide high-performance cutting for meat, vegetable, and fish.

【Knife Details & Warranty】 This chef knife blade is 8” long, and 2.2mm thick, the handle is 5.3” long, cutting angle is 15 degrees. The knife is 270g heavy. SHAN ZU provides a 12-month warranty on all knife products, please feel free to contact us if you meet any problem

Previous page Using high-quality steel to ensure our higher quality from the material By combining 67 layers of steel created a true Damascus knife Sheets are fused together at high temperatures to form a billet Through forging, the layers are integrated to make them stronger Repeat heated and hammered.,this process continues until the pattern is formed Next page 1 High Quality Steel 2 Folding Steel 3 Melting 4 Forging 5 Hammering

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great chef’s knife
reviews.reviewText: Excellent value. With proper sharpening, maintains a superb cutting edge. Good weight & balance. Attractive handle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Everything they said it is an more
reviews.reviewText: I do A LOT of fruits and vegetables per week. Just carrots alone, I prep 8 to 10 lbs. where we have a dog with extensive food allergies and I have to do food for her. Then on top of that there's all the prep for the rest of us in the house. I was getting fatigued using a Chef's knife and having problems with vegetables splitting into irregular cuts (no matter how sharp my Chef's knife was). After researching Nakiri knives I decided to invest in one. So incredibly grateful I did. This knife cuts with little effort and slices through the thickest vegetables without any hesitation leaving behind a smooth, even cut. Night and day in terms of Nakiri vs. Chef's knife. Highly recommend it. The knife is well made, well balanced, with a comfortable handle that keeps its comfort no matter how long you're using it for. My new favorite knife!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great Knife To Have For All ROund Kitchen Use
reviews.reviewText: The knife is good-looking, easy to hold, very sharp, and a good size. It can be used to slice everything but very small things and is equally good for shopping and cutting up other large veggies and fruits. High-quality steel.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice gift.
reviews.reviewText: Bought as a gift, looks and feels very nice. Very sharp out of the package, feels well balanced and cuts beautifully. I can't speak to the longevity, ease of sharpening or quality of the steel as I have only used it once when new. I first purchased a cheaper version from a different manufacturer that was on sale on Amazon. That one was absolute trash. This on the other hand appears to be a nice product.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 18, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very nice knife!
reviews.reviewText: To start, I am very pleased with the quality of this knife!I've only had this knife for about a week. I don't know how the blade will hold up but with that being said, i feel it is well built! One of the sharpest knives I own. When I purchased this, I didn't pay attention to the weight. When taken out of the box, I was almost disappointed with the weight but once I used it, I quickly changed my mind. Great product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars comfortable and super sharp
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. I did a quick review of knives. I'm at the age where I need to invest some money in kitchen knives. Our friend has Wusthof, which we enjoyed while staying at their vacation home. But they're terribly expensive. I think this will do until we get to that point where we can invest some money in the kitchen knives.I honestly don't believe this is Damascus's process for $50. And it's not the X50CRMOV15 that Wusthof is made out of.X50CRMOV15:0.5% Carbon: For better hardness as well as the ability to keep wear or corrosion at bay15% Chromium: For great tensile strength, reliable ability to retain an edge, and better power to resist wear as well as corrosion1% Silicon: For boosted strength.1% Manganese: For better hardness as well as brittleness0.8% Molybdenum: For boosted strength as well as machinability (flexibility during manufacturing process)0.20% Vanadium: For better hardenability as well as resistance to wear0.015% Sulfur: For better flexibility during the manufacturing process0.04% Phosphorus: For boosted strengthListen. I'm not running for the Iron Chef here.The AUS-10:X50CrMoV15 vs. AUS10AUS10 wins over the former in terms of edge retention ability. However, X50CrMoV15 is tougher and easier to sharpenThe only thing I have to remind myself is not to drop this knife or try to cut bones, because AUS-10 will chip the knife edge. Other than that, this knife has an ergonomic design (graduation in knife handle to the blade), and it's full tang with a big-ole bolt in the middle out of three bolts to hold it onto its G-10 handle, which is very ideal. Most of my pocket knives have G-10 handles.Yes, of course, I want the CTS XHP Steel kitchen knife with a G-10 handle, but let's be real. My tiny pocket knife cost $110, I can't imagine a kitchen knife costing anything affordable for the average joe.This is a good purchase. Buy it.Edit: I bought one more. The price is too good for this knife. I love using it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Great product. This knife is surprisingly sharp and has great balance. I purchased one for my dad and ended up having to buy a second because I loved it and had to have one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Beautiful, but unsure of blade quality
reviews.reviewText: I’ve owned the knife for one week. I absolutely love the weight, feel and balance. Its initial sharpness is as expected. I have used in our commercial setting several times and sharpened on a steel at least three times. The edge of the blade is showing slight jaggedness, which might be somewhat normal for Damascus steel. But if that continues, the long term result will be a less smooth blade. It seems like there are a lot of knives that advertise “Damascus Steel” but may not actually use that method.
Muy afilado, buen peso y cómodo...

Wasn’t expecting much because of the low price, but actually it’s pretty good. I do use it everyday in professional kitchen and after a few weeks of abuse it’s still sharp and cuts just perfectly. It’s bit on the heavy side though , 290g, if remember correctly. Happy with the purchase

Ładne czarne opakowanie noża zniszczone, połamane krawędzie pudełka. Całość była zapakowana tylko w papierową kopertę. Zupełna porażka a miał być to prezent. Nawet opakowanie z kremem potrafi być lepiej zabezpieczone przed uszkodzeniem niż taki drogi nóż.

Después de 4 meses de uso intensivo (el que se da en una cocina profesional), le pongo al cuchillo 5 estrellas de puntuación.Vino súper afilado, y después de estos 4 meses de uso, sigue cortando de maravilla. En efecto no corta como el primer día, pero pasando la chaira recupera rápidamente el filo y vuelve a cortar bien.Los únicos peros, no es de damasco original y el peso (bastante pesado al primer tacto, aunque a la hora de trabajar te acostumbras rápido y no lo notas).Relación calidad-precio perfecta (lo compré en una oferta).Sin duda muy recomendable.
Good quality and comfortable to hold
